posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Class spread: Rog13/Barb26/SD1 or Rog15/Barb24/SD1 or Rog16/Barb23/SD1 or Rog19/Barb20/SD1
Race: Dwarf or Gnome or Halfling
Starting stats: 16DEX/18CON or 18DEX/16CON (before racial modifiers)

You need to end up at 25DEX/21CON minimum so any combination of the above will work. Personally I prefer a pre-epic spread of Rog4/Barb16 but Barb20 works for the first three class spreads.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'm going to assume your damage will come from scaring the bejesus out of them then sneaking or hipsing then sneaking, or possibly all of the above - popping in from the shadows, shouting "Boo!" scarily and sneaking them. In any case, that means the higher sneaks you get the better, no? And that surely means the more Rogue the better. Thus I'd be thinking at least 15 or 17 levels of Rogue (my temptation would actually be 17 or 19 for 9 or 10d6), which means Yunim's dead right, you can't really afford more than SD cheese - assuming you want a very angry Hin indeed...

EDIT: I'm also a wee bit concerned about your feats. Of your 7 pre-epics, I'm assuming Dodge, Mobility, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus, Blind Fight and Knockdown are already taken. Because you're a WoGster you'd probably then also grab Sharpen Pencil Craft Wand rather than IKD (unavailable with your current Int) or Improved Critical. Leaving none. Then in epic (again an assumption) the Rogue bonus feats could be Improved Evasion, Defensive Roll and Epic Dodge (if you go for the 17 or 19 levels of the class - the 19 also enabling Crippling Strike). That leaves a further 7 feats, and I'd guess at EWF and Epic Prowess being 2, to sit alongside the 3 EDRs and the Terrifying Rage. Which leaves 1 spare for a Great Dex or Con - so I'll presume Dex so (with your 10 stat boosts) you'll end up with Dex 26 and Con 21. It ain't spectacular, Web. Of course, I may have all my assumptions wrong, in which case what do I know?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Rog4/Barb16 gives 16 skill points and +3 reflex compared to Barb20 which gives +1 AB and +1 fortitude. Not only does it improved playability as Orion2019 mentioned, it also lets you become a Rog19/Barb20/SD1 which is my preferred level layout. It has an extra feat compared to the other spreads which can be used for Crippling Strike or ESF: Int (or any other epic Rogue bonus feat).

If you do decide to drop HiPS then I would recommend a Rog/Barb/Figh such as Rog13/Barb23/Figh4 or Rog19/Barb15/Figh6.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
The NWN Wiki says :
Terrifying Rage
Type of feat: general (epic)
Prerequisite: epic barbarian 21st level, greater rage (4x per day), intimidate 25
Specifics: While the barbarian is raging, any enemy (with less than the barbarian's hit dice) that comes close to him must make a will save opposed by the barbarian's intimidate check or become panicked for 1d6 1d3 rounds. Opponents with up to twice the barbarian's hit dice will not flee but will receive a -2 penalty to attack and saving throw rolls. Creatures with more than at least twice the barbarian's hit dice are not affected by the rage.
Use: automatic while in rage
Notes Edit
  • Requires Hordes of the Underdark.
  • This feat's description incorrectly lists "epic barbarian" as a prerequisite. While 21 character levels are required, only 15 of them need to be barbarian levels. (More precisely, the feat "greater rage (4x per day)" is required.)
  • The earliest this feat can be taken is at the 24th character level (this is because the 25 intimidate ranks can only be achieved at level 22 or later, and there are no general or barbarian feats available in between the 21st and 24th level).
Can Terrifying Rage feat be taken on a non-Barb level?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
If you want to take even more Rogue levels then go for Rog24/Barb15/SD1 with a pre-epic spread of Rog8/Barb12. I didn't include that one since compared to a Rog19/Barb20/SD1 it loses 1 AB and 2/- DR in exchange for an extra Rogue feat, but it will let you get both Crippling Strike and ESF: Int instead of choosing one.

All of the rage feats must be taken on a Barb level. Terrifying and Thundering both require Barb15, Mighty requires Barb20.
